car.sidebarDescription:
If you were denied a loan for a car, your credit might be a reason. Traditional lenders probably won't approve you if:
- Your credit score is too low
- You may not have enough income to afford a car

**Don't worry-you still have options.**

apartment.text: I wanted to rent an apartment
apartment.sidebarDescription:
If your apartment application was denied, your credit might be a reason. Traditional landlords probably won't approve you if:

- Your credit score is too low
- You have an inconsistent payment history
- You already have too much debt

**Don't worry-you still have options.**

business.text: I wanted to start my own business
business.sidebarDescription:
If you were denied a loan to start your own business, your credit might be a reason. Traditional lenders probably won't approve you if:

- Your credit score is too low
- You don't have sufficient cash flow
- You already have too much debt

**Don't worry-you still have options.**

school.text: I wanted to go to school
school.sidebarDescription:
If you were denied a **federal student loan** the most common reason is:

* You might have a default on other federal student loans

Some immediate options to consider are **rehabilitation** or **consolidation** of your loans. To learn more explore [forgivemystudentdebt.org](http://forgivemystudentdebt.org/how-to-get-out-of-default)

---

If you were denied a **private student loan**, your credit might be the reason. Traditional lenders probably won't approve you if:
- You don't have sufficient cash flow
- You already have too much debt
- You don't have a co-signer

**Don't worry-you still have options.**

house.text: I wanted to buy a house
house.sidebarDescription:
If you were denied a mortgage, your credit might be the reason. Traditional lenders probably won't approve you if:

- Your credit score is too low
- Your income may be insufficient
- You may have too much debt

**Don't worry-you still have options.**

job.text: I wanted to get a job
job.sidebarDescription:
If you were denied a job because of your credit, it's likely because your credit history is unfavorable:
- Inconsistent bill payments may appear
- You may have high amounts of debt
- You may have on record a past bankruptcy or foreclosure

**Don't worry-you still have options.**

bank-account.text: I wanted to open a bank account
bank-account.sidebarDescription:
If you were denied a basic bank account, there are a few reasons that may have contributed:

- You may have bounced too many checks in the past
- You may have overdrawn an account and failed to pay that amount back
- You may have unfavorable credit

**Don't worry-you still have options.**

credit-card.text: I wanted to get a credit card
credit-card.sidebarDescription:
If you were denied a credit card, your credit might be the reason. Traditional lenders probably won't approve you if:

- Your credit score is too low
- Your credit history is unfavorable and/or insufficient

**Don't worry-you still have options.**

personal-loan.text: I wanted to get a personal loan
personal-loan.sidebarDescription:
If you were denied for a personal loan, your credit might be the reason. Traditional lenders probably won't approve you if:

- Your credit score is below 630
- You don't have sufficient credit history

**Don't worry-you still have options.**

car-insurance.text: I wanted to buy car insurance
car-insurance.sidebarDescription:
Insurers in some states are allowed to use your credit as one factor in deciding how much to charge you for, or to not offer you, insurance coverage. Lenders probably won't approve you if your credit score is below the companies standards.

**Don't worry-you still have options.**

utilities.text: I wanted to sign up for utilities
utilities.sidebarDescription:
If you were denied utility service, your credit history might be the reason. A utility company might not provide service to you if:

- You owe money on a previous account in your name
- You made payments inconsistently in the past.

**Don't worry-you still have options.**
